did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Director, Herbert Spencer Gasser, Subject Files, Series 4

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Herbert Spencer Gasser was Director of The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research 1935-1953. During his tenure he continued many of the administrative routines which had been established during the directorship of Simon Flexner. Thus, much administrative correspondence, in particular, matters dealing with personnel and administration of the physical plant are to be found in the papers of the Business Manager, Edric B. Smith, who served also, as Secretary of the Board of Trustees.
See FA137 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Subject Files, Series 3. See FA809 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Series 4.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Herbert Spencer Gasser, 1888-1963, physiologist, was Director of The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, 1935-1953. His early work at the University of Wisconsin and at Washington University was done on circulation and respiration, including the mechanism through which the heart is accelerated in exercise and the rate of decreased oxidation in the respiratory center. Later at Washington University and at Cornell University Medical College his major interest was in the physiology of nerve, developing electrophysiological techniques through the development of vacuum tube amplification and the cathode ray oscillograph. In collaboration with Joseph Erlanger, also of Washington University, he developed an exhaustive determination of the constants of nerve fibers and the classification of nerve fibers in accordance with their properties. The two men shared the Nobel Prize in Medicine and Physiology in 1944 for this work.

eventgrp.event: Graduate State Normal School of Wisconsin, Platteville
M.D. Johns Hopkins University Medical School
Instructor in physiology, Washington University St. Louis
Associate Professor in physiology, Washington University
Study abroad: University College, London; National Institute of Medical Research, London; Sorbonne, Paris; University of Munich
Professor physiology, Cornell University Medical College New York, New York
Director, The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York, New York
June, retired as Director; returned to work in his laboratory; Member Emeritus RIMR
Died May 11 New York Hospital, New York, N.Y. Cremated; ashes sent to sister. Interred family plot, Platteville, Wis.
Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine Shared with Dr. Joseph Erlanger
Kober Medal, Association of American Physicians

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The Herbert Spencer Gasser collection was deposited with the Rockefeller University Archives by The University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted from scholarly access. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Director's subject file.
One archive box of about five inches consists of materials originally arranged in a subject sequence in the Director's office.

did.unittitle: Biographical data. Minute adopted by Board of Trustees, RIMR on Cole retirement; Press release on Cole retirement. Typescript copy of address made by Dr. Gasser at Cole retirement dinner

Correspondence between Dr. Gasser, Mr. Debevoise Edric Smith and Francis G. Blake for War Department and John R. Paul for War Department and Yale Medical School on contract involving work of Peter Olitsky Leslie Webster and A. Sabin
Permissions granted from Journal Experimental Medicine

Correspondence which deals with press reports of retirements of Alexis Carrel and others; New York State Society for Medical Research and anti-vivisection legislation; Princeton sale; by-law changes as to outside compensation for Institute personnel or emeriti; function of the budget committee; tax exemptions as an educational institution; the Winterberg bequest

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deals with S.F.'s last illness and addresses for Memorial Meeting. Correspondence with Judge Learned Hand, Peyton Rous, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., and Raymond Fosdick. Includes copy of address by G. Ramon (Institut Pasteur) and sent by secretary of Academic des Sciences, Paris.

did.unittitle: Correspondence from Princeton University, Institute for Advanced Study, RIMR Princeton inviting science sections of League to take up residence in Princeton for duration of the war
Correspondence between Dr. Gasser and the University of Pa. arranging a work situation for Ralph B. Little veterinarian, after closing of Princeton labs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily nominations and voting for new members. Includes bibliography and evaluation for D.W. Woolley nomination and 1952 telegram announcing election to membership of P.D. McMaster and D.W. Woolley. 1962 October 10 letter granting H.S. Gasser emeritus status.

did.unittitle: Princeton Integration with New York City Laboratories

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of materials from the files of J.D. Rockefeller including correspondence with Seth Low (president of Columbia University) and letters written to him by T.M. Prudden and W.H. Welch when queried about usefulness of developing a research institute modeled after the Pasteur Institute in the United States. Materials brought together to help understand the original thinking in developing RIMR in New York City. Handwritten summary by H.S. Gasser.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Considerations for integration. Background notes of considerations leading to 2 May 1947 Trustee action to move toward integration. Includes 1943 6 page N.R.S. (Norman Stoll) holograph reporting on conference with C.T. (Carl TenBroeck). Handwritten notes by HSG evaluating the scientific work of the Institute at Princeton to determine what could not have been carried on in New York City; notes on factors to be considered in making a move to NYC; copy of property appraisal in NYC by Douglas Gibbons; copy of 1947 report requested by JDR, Jr. of HSG for an evaluation of how best to insure financial stability for the Institute's continued productivity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of H.S. Gasser 1947 report to John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Gasser correspondence with Carl TenBroeck (19 items), Richard Shope, John H. Northrop, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Harold W. Dodds (President of Princeton). Notes on meetings with Carl Ten Broeck, Northrop, and Shope and joint letter from Princeton Dept. employees reacting to integration decision. Copy of Separation Benefits established by RI for those employees to be terminated in move; notes and plans on moving benefits.

did.unittitle: Primarily correspondence with Lindsley F. Kimball in regard to sale of Princeton property after integration with New York City laboratories voted. Final sale in 1951 to Princeton University for James Forrestal Research Center in jet propulsion and related sciences

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 folders which consist of summary of scientific work, some letters of recommendation, in some instances list of publications and a short biography is included.

Murphy, James S. (Recommendation by J.H. Northrop)

Shaw, Elliott (Biography, bibliography and summary of work at RI)
Tallen, Harris H. (recommendation by Moore and Stein)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miss Von der Osten and Miss von Berg were both secretary to Dr. Gasser during this period. The file consists primarily of copies of letters sent to Dr. Gasser from his secretary while he was away from the office, either on professional business or on vacation. Includes his letter to his secretary informing her of his addresses en route or giving certain instructions.
Included are 28 pages of assorted items; notes, packing slips, instructions from the period 1954-1961 when laboratory was run with the aid of a technician.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: H.S. Gasser material found in inactive files of the RU Corporate Secretary/Faculty Administrator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1935 news release re Directorship and HSG biography; RI obituary and reprint of Bio. Mem. of Fell. Roy. Soc., Nov 1964, Vol. 10.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes re Directorship (1935) ; Nobel Prize (1944) ; death (1963) ; Robert Peter Coin (1965).
